review: Above and beyond as usually with Angela's courses! As for some outdated content - this is a tech field that changes rapidly, so nothing surprising here, took me some documentation surfing for the updates but overall most of the content can be followed and replicated. The textual part of the course was less engaging I admit but this is life of a programmer I guess, handholding ends at some point. Thank you, Angela!

Angela is one of the best. She teaches so effortlessly as if she was born to do it. She makes the lessons so simple that no matter how hard you try, you will find it difficult NOT to understand her. No matter how tired I am, I see myself clicking on the next lesson and the next lesson and the next lesson. Thumbs up Angie

Dobry kurs dla osób zaczynających przygodę z analizą danych oraz z uczeniem maszynowym. Dzięki wykładów można zrozumieć jak dokonywać analizy zbioru danych oraz jak działają modele uczenia maszynowego. Proponowane zadania pozwalają praktycznie przecwiczyc zdobytą wiedzę. Są one dobrze dobrane do poziomu osób przerabiajacych kurs. Kurs wymaga jednak tego, żeby poświęcić na niego trochę czasu. Czasami warto poszukać dodatkowych informacji w innych źródłach. Warto też samodzielnie robić zadania, sprawdzając poprawność rozwiązań. Można wówczas więcej skorzystać z kursu.

I have a B.S. in Computer Programming. My curriculum did not include Python, so I decided to give this a try. This course is amazing! I do not normally leave reviews, but I am very happy with the purchase.

Excelente curso para aprender Python desde sus bases hasta temas mas avanzados. Despues de estudiar este curso, podras continuar tu camino como programador en Python, hacia otras areas increibles de la programación y el desarrollo profesional que Python ofrece para ayudarte a ser mas productivo y destacar entre otras personas.
As others said, I think it should be way better balanced. Goes with the attempt to cover everything, which is positive, but sounds like creators "got tired" a bit before middle of it.
couldn't copy the file to pycharm..

it's a good experience to me to take this course and  i am the beginner to this python course and it is good that what i expected more from this course and i am so glad to take this udemy course so know am able to do the projects in my own way
A Really good and comprehensive course. Angel explains things very well and really knows her stuff. And with a subtle but engaging sense of humour.

Es un buen curso para empezar, se lo recomendaría a todos aquellos que  buscan un primer curso para aprender Python. Si ya tenés conocimientos intermedios, no lo elegiría. Entre las cosas que no me gustaron, una de ellas es la falta de actualización a algunos segmentos, que ya no funcionan como Angela Yu explica debido a actualizaciones. El otro punto "negativo" en lo personal fue la poca explicación de base de datos, que me parece un concepto fundamental para el desarrollo back-end, ya que se explica brevemente con lectura, siendo que por la importancia podría haberle dedicado un video más explicativo.
She is wasting time in many concepts and many of important concept she take quick time which would actually takes time so, According to me if you have lots of time then you can buy the same

Fantastic course. Very detailed. Great scaffolding of knowledge. I was a complete novice and am now half way and feel confident within this intermediate area. Looking forward to continuing and learning more

I can’t speak highly enough about this course. This is the best online course I’ve taken. It actually felt like I was in a classroom, especially with the questions that we could ask and share code snippets in different sections. Dr. Angela Yu’s lectures were very informative, well-structured, and made for effective learning. Thank you!

This Python course is truly great for beginners and even intermediate learners. The explanations are clear, and the exercises are engaging and practical. However, there are a few sections that feel a bit outdated, especially regarding newer Python features and libraries. Overall, it's an excellent starting point, but be prepared to supplement with newer resources for the latest in Python development.

So, i just finished the course and just have some Portfolio projects open, bc i work on my own porjects. And i have to say that the course is great if u are starting out with Python. If u have questions to will get an answer in a day. Thats impressive! But i also have to mention that in the end i didnt have that much fun, than in the beginning and the middle, bc all the lessons in the end are text based, you still get all the info you need but its just not that appealing anymore.

Not a good match for me.  My primary interest in Python is for data science.  This course spent way too much time on web development which holds absolutely no interest for me.  Even the areas where she did start to cover data science too often strayed into using it for web development.  I did not finish the course because I eventually lost interest.

Such a great content so far. The best part of the course is that the sequence Angela is following. And at the end of each day we are able to create a project in which we can apply all the things that we learn that day and previous day. This is very concise course that have overview related to python universe. But Anyone who wants to deep dive they have to explore along with the course. I appreciate the effort of Angela for such a great content with very good quality and organized manner.

I think this is one of the best and most explanatory courses I have ever taken. I am not even halfway through and still learned tons of new things. Angela is a beautiful teacher, and I hope he will do more uploads like this one.

few lessons are out dated with older APIs that either or unavailable Tequila or have issues with allowing users to actually send text unless you pay or go through a thorough process to verify your business: Twillio
The beginning of the course was so good, especially the motivation videos at the end of the course, very helpful

This was the course which gave me confidence that, I can code in python. For removing the mental block that i had towards coding, ill give this course 5+ stars, if possible. And this is my go to suggestion course to anyone tryna pick python.
A review from someone who had never written a single line of code, 1 year later after having finished the course.

Not recommended. Agree with many reviews that it became worst after Day 30. Need to be perseverence to google and sometime, the code could not work. I was motivated at the beginning but gradually lost hope with the instructor. A waste of time. Not worth the money.

I was a web developer several years back but advanced into management and hadn't spent much time coding or learning new code. This was a great class to familiarize myself with a new language and its peripherals while also getting back in the mindset of coding. I liked the structure of this course in that we could type along with Angela as she showed us the ropes, then try out what we learned with her "challenges", and quickly see the solutions. I felt this was a well-rounded course, walking us through the basics, then teaching how to use python in many ways (data manipulation and reporting, game creation, website creation, etc.). I'd recommend this course to beginners, or to the experienced programmers looking to learn about Python.

Python being my first programming language, I was a bit apprehensive about how challenging it might be. However, Angela's teaching style and the way she structured the course made it so easy to understand and enjoyable to learn.

Good at the start but once the lessons gets hard Angela thought that the best course of action is not make videos explaining the harder lessons but just throw some exercises and text especially in the later parts where there are literally no videos at all. She wasted her time making these "motivational videos" and add her corny jokes in her vids rather than making videos explaining concepts. Not saying I didn't learn anything but the people are expecting a lecture not reading.
everything was so good till the halfway i was loving it, but after that course became web dev focused, in the name of data science she only taught pandas, nothing else.

I started this course on the 1st of Jan 2023. I have just been offered a full-time position as a developer. It was this course that really got me engaged in programming and taught me the fundamentals so well. I will admit I got to about day 65 before I went off and coded my own web app, and then from there I have been building my own things. Thank you Angela!

great course. My first time leaving rating before finishing the course. She knows what she is doing. A great teacher, very easy to understand and follow. The exercise are well put together and scheduled in the most effective way to learn. AMAZING

Overall Course Curriculum and Teaching is Awesome! But I expect more video explanation than just providing text file at least to understand concepts (may be not for solution and challenges). Especially Data Science is new to all who shifted their career towards programming as me. I really don't understand the data science part. I hope it will be updated as video part as soon.
First 40 days are nice, after that she doesn't explain anything.
Angela's course is excellent and very comprehensive; I thoroughly enjoyed it. However, there are a few aspects worth noting.

Thank you, Angela, for excellent course. The course was really engaging, and I learned a lot. However, the Data Science section consisted solely of texts; a video explanation would have made this course more interactive.
This course was quite beneficial, but there are few instances where it could have been better. A general overview of ML working could have benefited more!

Appreciate the breath of content covered in this 100 days of code with Python. Different from other similar courses I have taken so far. You are left to fend for yourself in slogging out for better hands-on learning as the course progresses via intermediate to advanced content. Especially, the last 20 days where there are no guidelines other than the problem statement, which came as a surprise. But good exercises for reinforcing the learnings from this course and your overall coding experience so far. The downside is it takes way longer to complete this course then the indicated total hours, depending on the ability of the student.
In the beginning,  I was a bit hesitant as to whether I can learn python. After taking this course, I felt that this is a good one for beginners for me

I started this course to learn Python, but a lot of time is spent on other topics like HTML, which I may already know. Additionally, I don't like the courses without videos. They often don't work, which is frustrating. Specifically, it's frustrating to spend time on a project that doesn't interest me. For instance, I've never used the Tinder platform, so the project related to it is just annoying. If I need to analyse Tinder in a future job, I'll learn about it then, but for now, it doesn't engage me. The same goes for other social media-related projects. I would prefer to learn substantial material rather than focus on flashy, superficial projects.
Akıcı bir şekilde gerekli bilgileri öğrenip kullanabileceğimiz projelerin olması bu kursu rakiplerinden bir adım öne çıkarıyor.
This is the best course I have ever bought on Udemy. Thank you so much, Dr. Angela, for creating such a comprehensive and well-organized course.
I am currently halfway in the course and it is fantastic! The course is outstandingly well-structured, with clear explanations and engaging projects that make learning Python enjoyable.

Angela is lovely and her classes are well done. However, at the end of the course, she left us with only classes in text, which I understand why and was OK with, but some topics could have a video explanation. Also, there may be some repetitiveness in topics: In my opinion, there was too much web development in a Python Course (I even bought her Web Development Course which I'll start soon), and I wish the course were more focused on Python. I was expecting more advanced topics like multi-threading and machine learning. The course is a good head start in the language, though.
Good till class 45, then you are left on your own to figure out stuff.

First half of the course is great. Video lectures are interesting, challenges sometimes are hard, but fair. I was really involved in python learning. Second part of the course is terrible. Second part contain most important and complex python frameworks and there are no video lectures, lack of info and advices like "find info by yourself". I understand this way of learning and it can be applied sometimes, but full Flask section (very important framework) made in this lazy style and this is unacceptable! Also some materials are outdated.

At the beginning it was a nicely explained and thoroughly explained each point but latter on when actual critical part starts especially from API no explanation videos started, this really bad because its not just someone put projects with solution with no explanation and let people struggle with understanding. Really disappointed.
It was great when we were following along with videos to understand concepts only for the rest to just be text for telling us to use outdated documentation and vague instructions.
It's so good,her teaching is really understandable,glad and grateful that i took this course!

Starts out really well with lots of instructional videos but the amount of those decreases after like the first half and the course gets diluted by daily project assignments with just a few instructions. While one could say that a programmer needs to learn on his own, too, it doesn't meet my expectations if someone advertises the course with "This course doesn't cut any corners..." and "$12,000+ Python Pro Bootcamp course materials and curriculum".
Good for beginners: This course is great for people who are new to programming.
Really comprehensive and very well structured. Angela explains everything so well that it is a pleasure learning with her!

Great course, great instructor... some parts are outdated, but it's part of learning a language you have to find the solution on your own sometimes (look at student and instructor comments in Q&A). There's a lot of value in this course far more than some people might need.

I'm deeply thankful for Angela's exceptional teaching, which not only facilitated my evolution from a novice to an advanced level but also introduced me to technologies like Scrapy and FastAPI. Currently, I'm expanding my expertise by diving into learning Django.

The course was good at the start but it slowly became obvious that she was not a Python expert. The section on Pandas was at a grade school level and the Tkinter section was taken from Mark Roseman's book with a few changes so it was not plagiarism. Very disappointed. Would not recommend.

There are some topics that should have been covered, specially working with APIs that have complex authentication process like auth2 etc and working with cookies in python. Cookies and sessions are basics in web development, should have been covered.

I would Like to thank Dr Angela Yu for her hard work and support in making this course, first I really use to think that uh I cannot do programming then I saw this course and it truly changed the Game of my Life. A HUGE THANK YOU TO DR ANGELA YU

Really good course to start out with!. However, half of the contents were given as guidelines for you to do it yourself (which is great because in order to learn to code, you need to code right?). But, to complete most of the challenge, student needed to use their own social platform or others like Gmail, etc.

This was a good course overall. You will learn a ton working through everything. However, to be clear, there are only 81 days of lessons, the last 19 are for projects where you are entirely on your own. Some days will take much longer than 1 calendar day to complete, particularly if you are working full time. The data science section is not explained well; this would be a great introduction for someone with prior data science experience wanting to learn how to do things in Python, but if you have no knowledge then the basics of data science itself are not taught. The first 30-40 days of the course have the most teaching/explanations, after that I strongly suggest looking through the comments for each lesson to learn updated ways of doing things when the course is outdated and for additional helpful tips.

This course is amazing. I highly recommend for those want to learn programming. This course is setup to help encourage learning (sample projects, great examples, engaging tutorials, and the list goes on). However, along with doing the exercises provided (in the beginner section), you should also do additional practice of the concept taught to really solidify the concepts before moving on.

Everything is very well explained and every "Day" has a lot of coding exercises and usually one bigger final project, so you get a lot of practise in programming and problem solving. I can really recommend the course!
The Course Content is really good but sometimes it seems to be bit longer for the people who are already know abt programming
My first step towards learning how to code, 100 days worthy.
I really like the course and the way it's presented. In particular, the many many code challenges and everyday-projects are really motivating and keep me always ready and curious what's ahead.
This course taught me a lot about python, web development, and data science.
I want to say thank you Angela for this amazing course, it's really useful for me and I'm enjoying it.

I do not recommend this course. It starts promising but gets repetitive after a while and somewhere, let's say day 40, it goes really downhill. It's not up to date weird mixture of lessons from other courses of this author with DIY sections where you most likely need to find some other Youtube tutorial in order to finish the lesson. Author says it's made this way in order to make you practice what you've learned, well I would say she just needed to fill the space in order to have "100 days" in course title. I liked other courses on web development from this author, but Python course was disappointing.
I am enjoying this course. It's like I wanna keep listening to the sessions and continue practicing daily cause am enjoying it and learning at the same time : )
The contrast in auditorium is hard to discern,  but she has no control over that.
Best Python course. Angela is the best teacher eveeer!
great course, very well explained and easy to follow, thanks !

The teacher is super helpful and explains things in a way that even I could understand very well and I used to think coding was like to memorize a whole other language, but this course made it feel like a fun puzzle!
The best online course I've ever had!
This course literally teaches you how to
You know how some teachers are in a league of their own, where they somehow instinctively know how to teach a new concept to anyone effortlessly? Angela is that teacher.
This course is incredibly good. Angela is the best tutor and I can recommend it to anyone who is motivated enough to learn Python.
I have written much Python code in my career. Python is evolving constantly and I thought this course would bring me up to date with the latest developments.

This is an awesome course. I had take Python courses on Udemy too before. But the course from Dr. Angela Yu is the clearest, most complete, easy to understand, has lots of new information, and has nice visuals.
This course is just awesome!
So far its a great course, mentor Angela Yu teaching method is very good and informative, nice challenges which keeps you motivated. Best way of teaching Python
Ultimate course to learn Python; after that, it's up to your experience.

Angela is BY FAR (!) the best teacher I have ever seen on Udemy. (and one of the best in general).  Her way of explaining is exceptional. Even things I use and 'sort of' understand are now way more clear.

Learning lots, and realizing this is way over my head lol. But I'm going to keep pushing through as I really want to learn to program. Angela is great and this whole course is moving at a decent pace that will keep you engaged and wanting more!

I wrote this in the beginning"Would be great if she showed the ways it can be done and what is preferred and also showed how to use new functions before assigning an assignment using new functions. The google search wastes time and motivation."

This has been such a wonderful learning experience. Not only are the lessons extremely easy to understand for someone who has never coded before, they're interactive and Angela knows how to keep your attention. I love the jokes as well so that's a plus!

I have not completed the course yet thats why I am rating this 4 stars, after completion it may change, very happy with the result, Dr Angela is a really good teacher. I also completed her web dev project.
good but i took the course for data science but it focuses more to be developer. The data science part is not well explained as web development parts
there can be desktop applications.

Whatever I say about this course it will never cover up all I feel about it.....I have so much respect for Angela because of they way she has designed and executed the course she made it so much fun and easy to learn some of the really complicated stuff when I started this I was working as a Salesforce admin but now I have a really good grasp of python and working as a "Admin cum developer" currently taking Angels's Web Developments BootCamp it is equally good and loving it too.
I was following this course for two whole months, now I resign.

I really love Angela's course, she explains well. The course is well structure and well understandable. I was keeping postponing starting the course but once I started I can't stop. I do at least 2 sections a day.
What went well:
"100 Days of Code" is a very optimistic name; it took me some 781 days to finish! Insane amount of coding knowledge, cool projects, and best practices. Angela Yu is a superwoman #python

So far one of the best courses I have done. I have already programmed several apps for my work that make everyday life easier for me and others. This would not have been possible in such a short time without this course. Everything is explained well and Angela creates a positive learning environment throughout the course.
Its hard to learn python without plenty of practice. Dr. Angela's course have a plenty of practice within the course which helps with mastering the concepts.
Clear explanations and interactive  exercises make understanding and memorizing the concept and applying it a piece of cake

A Angela é uma grande instrutora, muito didática. o Conteúdo é bem organizado e depois de cobrir toda a parte inicial (revisão geral conceitos básicos de programação usando Python), começa a entrar em assuntos especificos. Ainda estou em 1 terço do curso, mas até aqui estou gostando muito, entra na lista de top 5 cursos que já fiz na Udemy!

Let me start off by saying that I am at the end of day 15 intermediate section (at the time of this writing), and just completed the coffee-machine project on my own, which means up until this point, this course has served me well.  Cheers Dr. Angela for helping me do that.

Angela’s an awesome tutor, her courses are really well structured everything is explained thoroughly and repeatedly (without the repetition becoming redundant). You get to use the knowledge from all previous lessons in all future lessons. It is my second coding course with Angela and I am 500% satisfied with both of them. Also Angela’s super funny and gives great motivational advice so those two things are defo a plus to keep going when you are sat for hours learning something. Love this course, love the food jokes, love the energy! Thanks Angela 🙏🏻
The course is very good. It has been well structured. The lessons are well taught with good resources. It has improved my problem solving skills and thinking a lot. Very satisfied with the course :)

Literally best online course I've ever had. The classes are super fun, you get challenged, you code really cool projects and you come out the other end with so much value knowlege. Thank you a lot, Angela.

Good information, and there have been a couple of updates over the years to keep it current. Software continues to progress, however, and sometimes you just hit a wall and hasn't been addressed with updated coursework. Throughout a lot of the exercises (days 40-60, specifically) there are too many activities that force you to create external accounts with other services. Those outside services have also changed their products, pages, requirements, and documentation in many ways that can make it very frustrating in this course.
Save your money--go to Stack Overflow.
I am really sure how this course has such a high rating, Instructor covered the very basics of Python and left core concepts/ other for self learning.
If anyone really wants to learn python, this course is enough.
Great course, suitable for beginners, intermediates and advance. The explanations are clear and the content is easy to follow and understand. I wish more courses through udemy were like this one
I like the way of teaching, interactive and captivating for someone like me who has never had anything to do with IT field. I like it, Thanks!
Angela teaches very well and simple way that it is easy to understand the concepts
Earlier lessons were good. Lessons at the end was hard to understand
I love the way you teach, can you please create a course about full stack development. I want that course title but you don't have it yet. thanks
It was good and I reserve the Excellent rating for later use. I have nothing with which to compare at this time.
It's unbelievable to me what a great teacher is Angela and how great is that course.
all around very good, my only problem with the course is that you will need more than one hour a day, to finish the lectures and the excrieses some days you might need 3.

This course is great! A good refresher for the beginner portion but picked up new tricks along the way. Intermediate section is great introducing all kinds of new subjects I've never done before. Highly recommend this course.
Angela not only helped me understand Python but also released me from all my insecurities that I might not be built to ever become computer literate.
it was brilliant, it was fun doing it, dr. Yu is so special, but i need alot to practice. Practice is a problem
I don't think it's possible to find another course that is as easy to understand while also being really thorough about relevant topics.

This is the best course that I ever enrolled in. Instructor Angela yu always focusing on practicing everything that I learned.I want to give 10 star but limited to 5.i strongly recommend this course I am sure u will learn alot.

so far, this course is eye opening for me, i did not expected to learn this much in 25 days,  lecture is very easy to understand. also the examples of games and writing logics are very simplified. thanks to the Dr. Angela Yu, she explains very well, also i love the expirationla talk at end of each section ... Awsome teaching
I have definitely learned a lot of Python. I didn't know how complex it could be 😅.

I took your full stack boot camp as well. I'm a fan. Thank you very much for what you do. I am trying to change careers, and having an affordable way with two kids and a wife is very helpful. I hope to meet you someday. Keep doing what you're doing. You're great at it.
i only disappointed due to download function i downloaded all videos but it will not be played
corso molto interessante. esempi molto utili per migliorare. non do 5 stelle perché avrei fatto l’ultima parte di data analysis anche con video e non solo testuale.
I am really enjoying the course. I found the part, where you are supposed to make a lot of accounts a but annoying and skipped it though.

Angela Yu is the most incredible instructor I've ever met so far! Didactically brilliant, with a nice sence of humour and personal touch about every topic. I'm halfway through and enjoying this course as much as at the beginning. Love love love!
Course is good but some of links provided are not working in year 2024.
You, did not told that, there is a delay in API registration.
The course is quite well made. The excercises are interesting and you also get access to a testing interface. The lecturer is quite nice and supportive.
The course is just good. I wish Universities will just make one do this in a semester , life will be good.

I finished this course nearly a year ago, I had some basic knowledge of python so I just played video games while listening throught the first few lessons. Looking back, starting this course was the best choice I made that year. Numerous times have I used the knowledge I gained from it for other project thus helping the my whole team out. It thought me what is possible which I think is the most important: knowing your programming possibilities and the approach to them. It teaches very important topics that are crutial for understanding how the programming-world functions. This course is cleary above all else that I have bought in this platform.
Yes, is good and quite clear to understand.

Easy to understand Python in fun, enjoyable manner and the instructor is very cheerful and have depth knowledge about subject; even give more than expected and outstanding, brilliant. Give motivation and guidance throughout the course.

not too good experience with this course. i asked 3 or 4 questions but i never get answer for my queries . i also did 3 other courses from Udemy whenever i asked question on those courses i got quick reply. But for this course i asked question 2 month back still no reply.
Like the course as the teacher is motivated and the material is well presented, clear explanation, interesting and knowledge reachable project with solution a long the way.

Great teacher with awesome methodology! I can say that this is the best course for someone as me who start from the beginner or no experience with python to start it. Thank you for your course, my best teacher Dr. Angela.
